FW Fw important Subject A fine philosophy on life A philosophy professor stood before his class and had some items in front of him When the class began wordlessly he picked up a large empty mayonnaise jar and proceeded to fill it with rocks rocks about in diameter He then asked the students if the jar was full They agreed that it was So the professor then picked up a box of pebbles and poured them into the jar He shook the jar lightly The pebbles of course rolled into the open areas between the rocks He then asked the students again if the jar was full They agreed it was The students laughed The professor picked up a box of sand and poured it into the jar Of course the sand filled up everything else Now said the professor I want you to recognise that this is your life The rocks are the important things your family your partner your health your children things that if everything else was lost and only they remained your life would still be full The pebbles are the other things that matter like your job your house your car The sand is everything else The small stuff If you put the sand into the jar first there is no room for the pebbles or the rocks The same goes for your life If you spend all your time and energy on the small stuff you will never have room for the things that are important to you Pay attention to the things that are critical to your happiness Play with your children Take time to get medical checkups Takeyour partner out dancing There will always be time to go to work clean the house give a dinner party and fix the toilet Take care of the rocks first the things that really matter Set your priorities The rest is just sand But then A student then took the jar which the other students and the professor agreed was full and proceeded to pour in a glass of beer Of course the beer filled the remaining spaces within the jar making the jar truly full The moral of this tale is That no matter how full your life is there is always room for BEER Get your FREE download of MSN Explorer at

Re Weather Products Cc This descripton looks OK except for the actual product for December is a HDD not a CDD contract Thanks Michael Robert B Cass PM To Michael CT Mark CT cc Kevin NRON Melba CT Subject Re Weather Products Hi Michael and Mark Please revisit the Hong Kong test product for CDD as shown below Please note that it is based on the MelbourneSydney format A US Weather Cooling Degree Day Financial Swap Transaction with Enron North America Corp under which the Seller is obliged to pay the Payment Amount to the Buyer where the Floating Amount is above the Strike Amount or where the Buyer is obliged to pay the Payment Amount to the Seller where the Floating Amount is below the Strike Amount The Strike Amount is the amount in Cooling Degree Days submitted in the price field by Counterparty via the website The Notional Amount is the product of the quantity submitted by Counterparty via the website and the Pay Unit The Payment Amount is the product of i the Notional Amount and ii the absolute value of the difference between the Floating Amount and the Strike Amount The Calculation Period is from and including the Effective Date of Dec to and including the Termination Date of Dec The Calculation Period shall commence at am on the Effective Date and conclude at am on the Termination Date at the relevant Reference Weather Station or Fallback Reference Weather Station The Reference Weather Station is Hong Kong Observatory WMO Station Number The Fallback Reference Weather Station is Kings Park WMO Station Number Reporting Service Reporting Agency and Data Source all mean the Hong Kong Observatory A Nathan Road Kowloon Hong Kong or its successor organization The price is quoted in US Dollars per unit of volume which will be the Contractual Currency CDD shall mean Cooling Degree Day The Reference Basis is Degrees Celsius The Pay Unit is USD The Maximum Payout Limit is USD multiplied by the quantity submitted by the Counterparty via the website Michael Nguyen PM To Kevin NRON cc Robert B CT Subject Re Weather Products Kevin The following product descriptions for Hong Kong are incorrect Could you please contact Rob as he has created products for me using Australian cities as a template Thanks Michael Enron North America Corp From Kevin Meredith ENRON PM To Michael CT Mark A ES cc Robert B CT Melba CT Subject Weather Products The following products have been created in Test Please review and advise US Wthr CDD Swap HNG KNG K Jun USDCDD A US Weather Cooling Degree Day Financial Swap Transaction with Enron North America Corp under which the Seller is obliged to pay the Payment Amount to the Buyer where the Floating Amount is above the Strike Amount or where the Buyer is obliged to pay the Payment Amount to the Seller where the Floating Amount is below the Strike Amount The Strike Amount is the amount in Cooling Degree Days submitted in the price field by Counterparty via the website The Notional Amount is the product of the quantity submitted by Counterparty via the website and the Pay Unit The Payment Amount is the product of i the Notional Amount and ii the absolute value of the difference between the Floating Amount and the Strike Amount The Calculation Period is from and including the Effective Date of Jun to and including the Termination Date of Jun The Calculation Period shall commence at am on the Effective Date and conclude at am on the Termination Date at the relevant Reference Weather Station or Fallback Reference Weather Station The Reference Weather Station is Hong Kong Observatory WMO Station Number The Fallback Reference Weather Station is Kings Park WMO Station Number Reporting Service Reporting Agency and Data Source all mean the Hong Kong Observatory A Nathan Road Kowloon Hong Kong or its successor organisation Reference Time means AM LST The price is quoted in US Dollars per unit of volume which will be the Contractual Currency CDD shall mean Cooling Degree Day The Reference Basis is Degrees Fahrenheit and the Reference Degrees are in Fahrenheit The Pay Unit shall be USD The Maximum Payout Limit shall be USD multiplied by the quantity submitted by the Counterparty via EnronOnline US Wthr HDD Swap HNG KNG K Jan USDHDD A US Weather Heating Degree Day Financial Swap Transaction with Enron North America Corp under which the Seller is obliged to pay the Payment Amount to the Buyer where the Floating Amount is above the Strike Amount or where the Buyer is obliged to pay the Payment Amount to the Seller where the Floating Amount is below the Strike Amount The Notional Amount is the product of the quantity submitted by Counterparty via the website and the Pay Unit The Strike Amount is the amount in Heating Degree Days submitted in the price field by Counterparty via the website The Payment Amount is the product of i the Notional Amount and ii the absolute value of the difference between the Floating Amount and the Strike Amount The Calculation Period is from and including the Effective Date of Jan to and including the Termination Date of Jan The Calculation Period shall commence at am on the Effective Date and conclude at am on the Termination Date at the relevant Reference Weather Station or Fallback Reference Weather Station The Reference Weather Station is Hong Kong Observatory WMO Station Number The Fallback Reference Weather Station is Kings Park WMO Station Number Reporting Service Reporting Agency and Data Source all mean the Hong Kong Observatory A Nathan Road Kowloon Hong Kong or its successor organisation Reference Time means AM LST The price is quoted in US Dollars per unit of volume which will be the Contractual Currency HDD shall mean Heating Degree Day The Reference Basis is Degrees Fahrenheit and the Reference Degrees are in Fahrenheit The Pay Unit shall be USD The Maximum Payout Limit shall be USD multiplied by the quantity submitted by the Counterparty via EnronOnline
